article.title: European_route_E4

link.part: E 4 nearrnskldsvik. A common standard between Tornio and Gvle. Some roads of this standard have been converted to 2+1 road with a barrier.

article.paragraph: European route E 4passes from north to south throughSwedenfrom the border withFinland, with a total length ofconvert1590km. The Finnish part lies entirely withinTornioin northern Finland, and is actually onlyconvert800mmilong. The Swedish part, however, traverses most of Sweden except the extreme north and the west coast region, and is commonly considered the highway backbone of Sweden, since it passes in the vicinity of most of its largest cities (exceptions includeGothenburg,Karlstad,Vsters,stersundandrebro) and through the capitalStockholm. In particular, it is the mainline road used by most vehicle traffic, both personal cars and freight trailers, between the north (Norrland) and southern Sweden or beyond.

FromHaparandaon the Finnish border, it stretches south along theGulf of BothniatoGvle, then on a more inland route southwards. It ends inHelsingborgin Sweden, at the port for the ferry toElsinorein Denmark. Under the new system ofEuropean routes, it was planned to have been a part ofEuropean route E55E 55, but it remains in the pre-1992 designation (E 4) within Sweden, becauseCitation neededFebruary 2007the expenses connected with re-signing this long road portion would be too large. Besides the signs along the road, there are thousands of signs, especially in cities, showing how to reach the E 4 road. The road is now fully authorized as E 4 by the relevant authority, not as E 55.

North of Gvle the road is of mixed standard. Depending on the fashion at the time of construction it is either a single standard carriageway road, usuallyconvert8-13mwide, or a2+1 road, aconvert13-14mwide road with two lanes in one direction and one in the other with a steel wire barrier in between, or sometimes a motorway with two lanes in each direction. From Sundsvall and further north, the road passes through most larger cities as city streets.

South ofGvle, the road becomes an almost continuous motorway. On October 17, 2007, the final stretch of the motorway, betweenUppsalaandMehedebywas opened. South of Gvle, the speed limit isconvert110km/hmi/h0onon 60% andconvert120km/hmi/h0onon 30% of the road. North of Gvle there are varying speed limits, withconvert90km/hmi/h0on,convert100km/hmi/h0onandconvert110km/hmi/h0onas the most common. The speed limits on the main roads in Sweden were changed on many stretches in October 2008, which saw the introduction of the 120 km/h limit.http://www.vv.se/templates/page3wide24153.aspx

The E 4 is the fastest road to go from Germany/Denmark to areas north of thearctic circle, including places in Norway likeTroms. To go from Helsingborg to theNorth Cape, NorwayNorth Cape, the fastest road is E 4 toLule, thenEuropean route E10E 10, road 392, road 403,European route E08E 08and road 93 toAlta, NorwayAltaand on.
